game
Enum Faction

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<Faction>
      game.Faction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Faction>
public enum Faction
extends java.lang.Enum<Faction>

An enumeration listing the different available Factions, as well as providing methods for e.g. receiving different kinds of Pieces according to Faction and parsing Factions from Strings.

Author:
Tuure Saloheimo

values

public static Faction[] values()
Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
for (Faction c : Faction.values())
    System.out.println(c);

Returns:
an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

valueOf

public static Faction valueOf(java.lang.String name)
Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)

Parameters:

Throws:

java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null

getPawn

public Pawn getPawn(int row,
                    int column,
                    boolean team,
                    Board board)
Returns a Pawn-object or a Pawn-extending-object affiliated with the Faction calling the method. The returned Piece will have attributes set according to the given parametres.

Parameters:
row - the row of the location where the Pawn is to be placed
column - the column of the location where the Pawn is to be placed
team - the team the Pawn will belong to
board - the board on which the Pawn will be placed
Returns:
a Pawn-extending-object associated with the calling Faction, or a Pawn if the Faction is NONE.

getRook

public Rook getRook(int row,
                    int column,
                    boolean team,
                    Board board)
Returns a Rook-object or a Rook-extending-object affiliated with the Faction calling the method. The returned Piece will have attributes set according to the given parametres.

Parameters:
row - the row of the location where the Rook is to be placed
column - the column of the location where the Rook is to be placed
team - the team the Rook will belong to
board - the board on which the Rook will be placed
Returns:
a Rook-extending-object associated with the calling Faction, or a Rook if the Faction is NONE.

getOfficers

public Piece[] getOfficers(int row,
                           int column,
                           boolean team,
                           Board board)
Returns an array containing an instance of all the officer (i.e. not a Pawn or a King) pieces of the calling faction. Used when promoting Pawns

Parameters:
row - the row where the Pieces' possible location
column - the column of the Pieces' possible location
team - the team the Pieces will belong to
board - the Board on which the Pieces might be placed
Returns:
an array containing the officer pieces of the calling Faction.

getEquivalent

public Piece getEquivalent(Piece piece,
                           boolean team)
A method that gives an equivalent of a piece given as parametre, but which affiliates with the calling Faction. The returned Piece will have it's attributes set accordingly to the piece given as parametre, except for team which will be set according to the given parametre.

Parameters:
piece - the Piece the equivalent of which will be returned
team - the team of the Piece to be returned
Returns:
a Piece equivalent to the given Piece-parametre, but affiliated with the calling Faction, or null if the equivalent couldn't ba made (most likely because the Piece-parametre was null).

parseFaction

public static Faction parseFaction(java.lang.String string)
A method that parses the String-values associated with each Faction back to the according Faction.

Parameters:
string - the String to be parsed into Faction
Returns:
the parsed Faction, or null if the parsing wasn't succesful.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

toString in class java.lang.Enum<Faction>
